intro: Sinosidus albescens var. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-flowered sinosidus, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, though the variety glabratus is distinguished by its smoother foliage. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within forest understories.
